sources.title: Moontide (1942)
sources.description: After a drunken night out, a longshoreman thinks he may have killed a man. Watch on RetroFlix:  https://archive.org/details/moontide-1942

sources.title: Moontide (1942) Directors: Fritz Lang & Archie Mayo, Featuring Jean Gabin, Ida Lupino
sources.description: Moontide is a 1942 American Film Noir directed by Archie Mayo, who took over production after initial director Fritz Lang left the project early in the shooting schedule. The screenplay was written by John O'Hara and Nunnally Johnson, based on the novel written by Willard Robertson, Moon Tide (1940). The production features French star Jean Gabin, as well as Ida Lupino, Thomas Mitchell and Claude Rains. Charles G. Clarke was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Cinematography for Black & White. Despite charismatic performances by its leads, the film didn't make a big impact upon release, though now it's been critically lauded as a precursor to film noir. These Wikipedia and Senses of Cinema articles provide more information about this movie.

sources.title: 1942 - Moontide - Marea de luna - Archie Mayo
sources.description: 1942 - Moontide - Marea de luna - Archie Mayo

metadata.Plot: After a drunken binge on the San Pablo waterfront, longshoreman Bobo fears he may have killed a man. In his uncertainty, he takes a job on an isolated bait barge. That night, he rescues lovely Anna from a watery suicide attempt and installs her on the barge. But Tiny, Bobo's longtime pal and parasite, hopes to drive Anna away before domestic bliss tears Bobo away from him; the still unsolved murder may be just the wedge Tiny needs. There's fog on the water and evil brewing...
metadata.Writer: John O'Hara, Willard Robertson, Nunnally Johnson
metadata.Actors: Jean Gabin, Ida Lupino, Thomas Mitchell
metadata.Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. 2 wins & 1 nomination total
